summary: MoneyGram's response to a federal subpoena dated August 16, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein-related financial investigations. The company conducted searches for wire transfers and online accounts associated with names/identifiers provided in the subpoena but found no matching transactions or accounts within their seven-year retention period.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to MoneyGram
events.description: A federal subpoena was issued to MoneyGram requesting information related to specific names, addresses, identification numbers, and/or telephone numbers for the period August 16, 2012 to August 16, 2019.

events.title: MoneyGram Subpoena Response
events.description: MoneyGram formally responded to the federal subpoena, reporting that searches of their wire transfer and online account databases found no transactions or accounts matching the exact identifiers provided.

keyFacts: MoneyGram received a federal subpoena on August 16, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation (Case No. 1908-US-125653).
The company searched its databases for wire transfers and online accounts associated with specific identifiers from August 16, 2012 to August 16, 2019.
No matching transactions or accounts were found in MoneyGram's systems for the exact identifiers provided in the subpoena.
MoneyGram noted that searches require exact spelling matches and that they don't maintain records of individuals who purchased or cashed money orders.
The response indicates federal investigators were examining potential financial transactions involving Epstein associates through money transfer services.
